The strong (rather than conditional) recommendation, in the context of organized screening programs, was instead a result of a balance of health effects that favor the intervention—with moderate (not high) overall certainty in the evidence about these effects—and cost-effectiveness that probably favors screening.Dr. Jörgensen and Mr. Paludan-Müller incorrectly cite a GRADE article about prognosis (reference 5 in their comment) when raising an issue about effects ...References1.
